charitySearchResults.name: Alzheimer's Society
charitySearchResults.description:
Alzheimer’s Society is transforming the
landscape of dementia forever.
Until the day we find a cure, we will create a
society where those affected by dementia
are supported and accepted, able to live in
their community without fear or prejudice.

charitySearchResults.name: Macmillan Cancer Support
charitySearchResults.description:
Being told ‘you have cancer’ can affect so much more than your health – it can
also affect your family, your job, even your ability to pay the bills.

We’re here to help you find your best way through from the moment of diagnosis,
so you’re able to live life as fully as you can.

charitySearchResults.name: Cancer Research UK
charitySearchResults.registrationNumber: Registered charity No. in England and Wales 1089464, Scotland SC041666
charitySearchResults.description: Cancer Research UK is the world's leading charity dedicated to beating cancer through research. We are fighting cancer on all fronts, finding new ways to prevent, diagnose and treat it to save more lives.  We are entirely funded by the public. With your help, we can ensure more people beat cancer.

charitySearchResults.name: British Heart Foundation
charitySearchResults.description: We raise money to fund research to keep hearts beating and blood flowing. Our vision is a world without heart and circulatory conditions like heart diseases, stroke, vascular dementia and their risk factors like diabetes. Together, we can beat the heartbreak these conditions cause.

charitySearchResults.name: Mind - The Mental Health Charity
charitySearchResults.description:
We’re Mind, the mental health charity.
We believe no one should have to face a mental health problem alone. We’re here
for you. Today. Now. Whether you’re stressed, depressed or in crisis. We’ll listen, give support and advice, and fight your corner.

charitySearchResults.name: Little Princess Trust
charitySearchResults.description:
Little Princess Trust provides real hair wigs, free of charge to children & young adults that have lost their own hair through cancer treatment and other illnesses.

Please visit us at www.littleprincesses.org.uk to find out how we have given away over 6,000 free wigs. Please help us to give more.

charitySearchResults.name: PROSTATE CANCER UK
charitySearchResults.registrationNumber: Registered charity No. 1005541 and in Scotland (SC039332)
charitySearchResults.description: Prostate Cancer UK fights to help more men survive prostate cancer and enjoy a better quality of life. We find answers by funding ground-breaking research, we lead change by raising the profile of the disease and improving care. And we support men by providing vital information and services.

charitySearchResults.name: Diabetes UK
charitySearchResults.description: Diabetes UK is the charity leading the fight against the most devastating and fastest growing health crisis of our time, creating a world where diabetes can do no harm. It’s a fight that involves all of us – sharing knowledge and taking diabetes on together. Until we achieve our vision. Join us.

charitySearchResults.name: Great Ormond Street Hospital Children's Charity
charitySearchResults.charityDisplayName: Great Ormond Street Hospital Children's Charity
charitySearchResults.description: We fundraise to enhance Great Ormond Street Hospital’s ability to transform the health and wellbeing of children and young people. Donations help to fund advanced medical equipment, child and family support services, pioneering research and rebuilding and refurbishment.

charitySearchResults.name: Marie Curie
charitySearchResults.registrationNumber: Registered charity No. 207994 (England & Wales) and SC038731 (Scotland)
charitySearchResults.description: Marie Curie provides care and support for people living with any terminal illness across the UK. Our nurses work night and day in people’s homes and our hospices offer specialist care. We also support people emotionally, provide practical information, and match them with trained volunteers.

charitySearchResults.name: Parkinson’s UK
charitySearchResults.registrationNumber: Registered charity No. 258197 and Scotland SC037554
charitySearchResults.description:
Every hour, someone in the UK is told they have Parkinson's. Because we're here, no one has to face Parkinson's alone.

We offer friendship, support, expert information and advice.

We also fund ground breaking research into Parkinson's and we're leading the way to find a cure.

charitySearchResults.name: Motor Neurone Disease Association
charitySearchResults.description: The MND Association is the only national charity in England, Wales and Northern Ireland dedicated to improve care and support for people affected by MND, fund and promote research, and campaign and raise awareness so the needs of people with MND are addressed by society. Visit www.mndassociation.org

charitySearchResults.name: The Prince's Trust
charitySearchResults.description:
We help disadvantaged young people in the UK to change their lives and get into work, education or training.  
This year, The Trust aims to support 58,000 vulnerable young people, helping to give them the skills and confidence to find a job.  We cannot do this without your vital support.

charitySearchResults.name: NSPCC
charitySearchResults.description: We’re the only charity fighting to end child abuse in the UK and Channel Islands. That’s why we help children who’ve been abused to rebuild their lives, we protect children at risk, and we find the best ways of preventing child abuse from ever happening.

charitySearchResults.name: Breast Cancer Care
charitySearchResults.description: Breast Cancer Care is the only specialist UK-wide charity providing support for anyone affected by breast cancer. Call us free on 0808 800 6000 or visit breastcancercare.org.uk

charitySearchResults.name: Stroke Association
charitySearchResults.description:
Stroke is sudden and devastating, striking every five minutes in the UK. It can take away your speech, your ability to walk, your memory and your independence. 
Please donate now to help those affected by stroke take back control, reclaim their independence and live their lives again.

charitySearchResults.name: Bloodwise (formerly Leukaemia and Lymphoma Research)
charitySearchResults.description:
We've changed the world for people with leukaemia, lymphoma, myeloma and other blood disorders - but we won’t stop until every single one of the 38,000 people diagnosed with a blood cancer each year survives and can live their lives to the full.

Your contribution really will make a difference.

charitySearchResults.name: Alzheimer's Research UK
charitySearchResults.description: Alzheimer's Research UK is the UK's leading dementia research charity. As research experts, we fund world-class pioneering scientists to find preventions, treatments and a cure for dementia. We encourage everyone to join us in supporting research and achieving a world free from dementia.

charitySearchResults.name: Teenage Cancer Trust
charitySearchResults.description: We are dedicated to improving the quality of life and chances of survival for young cancer patients aged 13-24. We fund and build specialist units in NHS hospitals and provide dedicated staff, bringing young people together so they can be treated by teenage cancer experts in the best place for them.

charitySearchResults.name: Maggie's Centres
charitySearchResults.description:
Maggie’s Centres are warm and welcoming places built alongside NHS hospitals that provide the emotional, practical and social support that people with cancer and their family and friends need. 
www.maggiescentres.org
